answerText: Soul Mountain [or Lingshan][10] Gao, the author of Soul Mountain, wrote this play, whose title refers to the Buddhist state of paramita. The play begins with a rope-game, and after the cast moves to the title location, a woman is killed by the crowd.
heading: Penn-ance |2012 | 12 | 11 | Literature | World | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: The protagonist of this novel, identified as both "You" and "I," meets women all identified as "She." For 10 points each: [10] Name this work of Chinese literature about an unnamed narrator who journeys to find the title entity after a misdiagnosis of lung cancer.
